channel.title: New local problems on FixMyStreet
channel.description: The latest local problems reported by users

item.title: Still ongoing rubish in lamb lane!!, 12th June
item.description:
This problem has yet to be resolved, The bins on Lamb Lane are CONSTANTLY overflowing and it is encouraging more fly tipping in the area. This area has become a rubbish tip! What ever you are doing is not working!

Nearest address to the pin placed on the map (from OS Places API): Mare Street, Hackney, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Constant rubbish!, 12th June
item.description:
Plumstead Road, by M&S and Barclays, all the way along to Sainsbury's is, a constant eye sore. The rubbish makes the, so called riverside place to live, look like a slum! It's absolutely disgraceful, we are charged a service charge, and a council tax for this to be cleaned. So where is the money going? Get it sorted! Thank you.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Plumstead Road, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Garbage is scattered across the pavement., 12th June
item.description:

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Sweden Gate, Rotherhithe, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Why has this tree been left?, 12th June
item.description:
I am a resident of Garden Avenue and the tree outside my house has not been cut back like the rest of the trees in the street. We are constantly clearing our drive way of broken twigs and when earlier in the year our cars get covered with extremely sticky cap. The gardens did attend last week and removed branches from all the lower parts of the Trunks in the street, but left a mess to be blown down the street. I would appreciate that this tree gets attended to ASAP. The road cleaners have been in my street today clearing the roads, so I take it your gardens were not intending on coming back to 'One of the largest trees in the street'. I look forward to hearing from you.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Garden Avenue, Barnehurst, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Daily occurrence!, 12th June
item.description:
Why is the camera not being utilised to catch whoever is dumping rubbish in the same area, virtually on a daily basis. As soon as materials from the previous illegal dumping mission has been cleared, something else is dumped! Now our area is being tagged. Bexleyheath has turned into an absolute dump, now full of residents who do not care about their local area. Why?! Can the tagging please be removed when the polystyrene packaging is removed.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Albion Road, Blendon, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Pavement broken, 12th June
item.description:
Pavement is broken - trip hazards. One pavement moves when step on it. Another example of council roof work destroying the paths. Please could this be fixed. Thank you. The contractors should pay for all the damage they have done in the local area.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Middle Park Avenue, Middle Park, London
